titlestmt.titleproper: Partial Preliminary Inventory to the Ronald Hilton papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-10-03T09:13-0700

change.item: Disk imaged CDs in box 23. For access to content of disks, contact the digital archivist.
Added access copy information for reformatted audio tapes.
Note on availability of use copies added.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Ronald Hilton Papers)//EN" "hiltonro.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

physdesc.extent: 111 manuscript boxes, 3 oversize boxes, 1 oversize mounted article, 1 oversize map

did.abstract: Writings, correspondence, printed matter, sound recordings, video tapes, and photographs relating to international relations and their study at Stanford University; the history of, and political, social, and economic conditions in, Latin America and Spain; Soviet historiography on Herbert Hoover and American food relief to Russia; and language as a factor in politics in multilingual countries. Includes recordings of interviews of Latin American leaders, and editorial records of World Affairs Report.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Use copies of all sound recordings in boxes 2-16 and videorecordings in boxes 30-31 are available for immediate access. To listen to other sound recordings or to view other videos, films, or digital files during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Ronald Hilton papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1980.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Hilton Latin American collection, Trinity University, San Antonio, Texas

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: American educator; director, Institute of Hispanic American and Luso-Brazilian Studies, Stanford University, 1942-1964; editor, World Affairs Report, 1970- .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Writings, correspondence, printed matter, sound recordings, video tapes, and photographs relating to international relations and their study at Stanford University; the history of, and political, social, and economic conditions in, Latin America and Spain; Soviet historiography on Herbert Hoover and American food relief to Russia; and language as a factor in politics in multilingual countries. Includes recordings of interviews of Latin American leaders, and editorial records of World Affairs Report.

Highlights of the first seventeen boxes of this collection include: 1 folder (in Box 17) containing biographical information on Valentin M. Berezhkov, assistant to Soviet foreign minister Molotov, and an article by Keith Tuber, 1993, relating to Berezhkov's recollections of Soviet diplomatic history during World War II; and 1 videotape cassette (in Box 17) of an interview of Berezhkov conducted by Ronald Hilton in 1993, relating to the German invasion of the Soviet Union in 1941.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Printed article by Ronald Hilton entitled "Bread: A Pretext for Soviet Defamation of Presidents Hoover and Carter," World Affairs Report (March 1980), and research material assembled in the course of writing the article.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conference papers, other writings, and printed matter relating to language as a factor in politics in multilingual countries.
